poem:
The Waves  

In the shadowed glen of time,
women's voices, a thrumming tide,
fought fierce currents, dreams aligned,
but split by hidden riptides wide.  
Not a single anthem sung,
but a chorus, threads undone,  
in whispers sharp and banners high,  
fractured unity beneath one sky.
